node.title: Step back in time when the 'romantically adventurous' ventured underground
node.alt: A small group of people in a cave lit by warm lights
node.description: From adventurous honeymooners trekking by candlelight to a feminist discovering the fossil of a seven-foot-six megafauna kangaroo during a sit-in, Ngilgi Cave in Western Australia's South West is rich in history.
node.content:
["Since 1900, Ngilgi Cave has been\u00a0the unlikely honeymoon destination, the site of a world record feminist cave sit, and the home of an infamously narrow tunnel.\u00a0", "But the human history of Ngilgi began\u00a0with the Wardandi people,\u00a0whose Dreamtime story of the spirit Ngilgi gives the wondrous underground network its name.", "Ngilgi Cave site manager Tod Kearns says the Wardandi people have known about and used the cave\u00a0for more than 60,000 years.", "It wasn't until the 1890s that Europeans first learnt of the cave.\u00a0", "In the early 1900s entrepreneur Edward Dawson\u00a0managed to convince waves of adventurous young honeymooners from Perth to explore the underground attraction.", "", "
In the early 1900s large numbers of young honeymooners visited Ngilgi Cave.\u00a0(Supplied: State Library of Western Australia, The Battye Library)
", "Mr Kearns said the trip would have been a huge adventure for the travellers who visited the site in groups of 40 or 50.", "", "
Ngilgi Cave was one of the earliest tourist destinations in regional Western Australia.\u00a0(Supplied: Margaret River Attractions)
", "They then slept in swags at the cave's entrance, before braving an eight-hour trek through the underground with no boardwalks, lighting or infrastructure.", "\"Because they were mostly on their honeymoon, they would dress up in their finest attire for the journey,\" Mr Kearns said.", "He said the \"romantically adventurous\" would sometimes break away from the main group to a dark corner of the cave for their \"romantic endeavours\".", "\"That [spot] became coined 'Cupid's Corner'.\"", "
Victim of its own popularity
", "Ngilgi enjoyed steady popularity with tourists until the 1920s before a\u00a0visitor infamously became stuck in one of the cave's key passageways.", "\"He was an accountant named Heinrich Harney, a very large man.", "Mr Kearns said they removed most of Harney's clothes and slathered him in cooking oil in a desperate attempt to free him.", "", "
Tod Kearns says the unfortunate story of Heinrich Harney led to the creation of a more accessible passage through the cave.(Supplied: Elements Margaret River)
", "\"All the while, he's wedged in this hole there were two families with young children trapped in the main chamber because Heinrich was blocking the exit.\"\u00a0", "Harney was eventually freed but the incident made quite a splash in the press.", "The passage became known as \"Harney's Pinch\".", "About\u00a040 years later the publican of nearby Caves House Hotel paid a Kalgoorlie miner to pack explosive gelignite into the walls of Harney's Pinch to create a more accommodating passage for visitors.", "
Beautician with a mission
", "In 1963, Ngilgi was in the media spotlight again when local beautician Dorothy Williams embarked on a world record 90-day cave sit.", "\"She did it because there was a local man named Wyndham Rendell that came down just before her and set the world record at 87 days in the cave without leaving,\" Mr Kearns said.", "Williams did not just want to one-up Rendell, she was out to make a statement.", "", "
Dorothy Williams explored the cave during her 90 days underground.(Supplied: Margaret River Attractions)
", "Not only did she smash the record by three days, she also explored the depths of the cave and discovered a range of ancient animal fossils, sparking huge interest from\u00a0palaeontologists.", "\"She found the fossil of a seven-foot-six tall megafauna kangaroo.", "\"Since then, we've found other species of marsupial \u2013 a wombat that was as big as a cow known as a Zygomaturus.\""]
